solution_line_template: The sum of black and white shirts is {black_shirts} + {white_shirts} = <<{black_shirts}+{white_shirts}={sum_of_shirts}>>{sum_of_shirts}
The number of jeans in the store is ({jeans_numerator}/{jeans_denominator}) x {sum_of_shirts} = <<({jeans_numerator}/{jeans_denominator})*{sum_of_shirts}={num_jeans}>>{num_jeans}
The sum of ties and belts is {num_ties} + {num_belts} = <<{num_ties}+{num_belts}={sum_of_ties_belts}>>{sum_of_ties_belts}
The number of scarfs in the store is {sum_of_ties_belts}/{scarf_divisor} = <<{sum_of_ties_belts}/{scarf_divisor}={num_scarves}>>{num_scarves}
There are {num_jeans} - {num_scarves} = <<{num_jeans}-{num_scarves}={difference_jeans_scarves}>>{difference_jeans_scarves} more jeans than scarfs in the store.
